title: DirectX Error
body: Recently when I enter a game after Champ Select I run into a constant Unknown DirectX Error. Stating "An unknown DirectX error has occurred and League of Legends cannot start. Please make sure your video card is using the latest video drives from the manufacturer." I've tried initating a Full Repair in League of Legends and watching videos. Most videos are telling me to get an AMD Graphics Drive which costs about 300$. Before I try to reinstall do you know anything that might help with this problem?

replies.body: Direct X issues are very common errors when a driver crashes or fails to render an asset like game files.  In this case, I recommend going over the steps of the [game crash](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761974-Bug-Splat-and-Game-Crashes+) guide to troubleshoot, adjust settings, and update drivers.  A repair was a good step, but we really want to focus on drivers as well!

when i got this error  i deleted the file 'game.cfg' in the config folder . i also ran the hex tool and set my dns to public .  reboot after making changes .
use training mode to test loading the map . 

hope it helps.
I also had this problem, a simple reset fixed it.

I had this error a couple weeks ago and fixed it by deleting a file in the settings folder and then repairing the client afterwards so the client replaced the file on it's own.

You don't need a new graphics card or anything like that, and you can check if you have the most recent direct x by just running a direct x diagnostic.  As long as it's 11 or 12 version your probably fine.

I'm trying to install League and it just won't get past the dx9 installation. I'm on the latest win10 fall creators update, all drivers are updated also running the installer as admin and tried compatibility mode too.

> **Error D:\Riot Games\League of Legend/Prerequisites/Dx9/dxsetup.exe/silent : child killed : unknow signal 
> The application will exit now.**
